result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Craig A. Kozak

records.addlTxt: Status hearing on November 28, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

10:14 AM DA calls case and states appearances. Defendant Craig A. Kozak in court.  Attorney Robert E Eaton appeared by phone for Craig A. Kozak.  Attorney Karl J. Kelz in court for State of Wisconsin. Complaint acknowledged, reading waived. Preliminary hearing requested, time limits waived. Bond already set and is to continue. So Ordered Court orders Pre-trial conference be scheduled 09/19/2022 at 1:30 PM

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: 1:46 PM Defendant Craig Kozak appeared in person with Attorney Robert Eaton who appeared by telephone. Karl J. Kelz appeared for the State of Wisconsin. DA Kelz states this matter has been set for a motion hearing by the defense for bond modification. Attorney Eaton questions the court on the hearing type. Court clarifies what is being heard today. Attorney Eaton states his motion is to modify the bond to allow contact with the victim. DA Kelz gives statements in objection to the motion filed by the defense. Court questions the victim's father on placement. Victim's father addresses the court. Court questions the Victim's mother. The victim's mother addresses the court. DA Kelz objects to the victim making a statement. Attorney Eaton makes statements in opposition to DA Kelz's objection. The court will not hear a statement from the Victim at this time. Court addresses the parties. Attorney Eaton suggests the victim be appointed a guardian ad litem. Court states this matter would need to be addressed in a family court setting to address the minor's placement and needs. Court orders the bond to stay as it was previously set. Comments by parties. Adjourned 2:07 PM
Demand for discovery and notice of intent to use DNA

Adjustment Number: 22A 001119,
Payable Number: 62441,
Receipt Number: 22R 001951,
Amount: $20.00
Notice of Motion and Motion to Modify Bond

Defendant may not have contact with the individual(s): T.A.L
**No Contact includes: Going to or remaining in any place the individual resides, is employed at, attends school at, or any public location the individual is temporarily located. Contact through means of telephone. Electronic devices, Social media, email, regular mail, or a 3rd party individual is prohibited. The only exception to this order is contact through your attorney or law enforcement in appropriate circumstances.

2:07 PM DA calls case and states appearances and possible charges.  Defendant's next court date is 07/19/2022 at 10 am.  Jail gives Defendant a notice of right to attorney.  Court questions parties as to bond.  DA states bond recommendation. Attorney Eaton objects to the no contact condition. DA Kelz gives responses to Attorney Eaton's objections. Court makes comments. Attorney Eaton questions the defendant. Defendant responds to questions. Court orders Bond as requested by the State.
